items.name: CollaborationInviteAnyMesheryCloudUserOrAllMesheryUsers

items.name: KanvasDragNDropPatternMergeWithExistingNodesOnCanvas
items.feature: Like a Google Doc, Designs are a user's primary tool for collaborative authorship of their infrastructure and services. A Design describes all the resources and their properties that users wants for a single deployment based on Meshery’s declarative syntax. This permission grants the user the ability to drag and drop a design onto the canvas to merge with exisitng nodes on canvas.

items.name: KanvasLoadDesignPatternDisplaceCurrentNodesOnCanvas
items.feature: Like a Google Doc, Designs are a user's primary tool for collaborative authorship of their infrastructure and services. A Design describes all the resources and their properties that users wants for a single deployment based on Meshery’s declarative syntax. This permission grants the user the ability to drag and drop a design onto the canvas to displace the exisitng nodes on canvas.

items.name: KanvasEditComponentConfugurationRjsfTooltips
items.feature: In Meshery, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to configure a component currently present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasDeleteComponents
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to delete a component from canvas.

items.name: KanvasCloneComponents
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a component, along with it's configuration, on canvas.

items.name: KanvasCopyComponents
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a component, along with it's configuration, on canvas.

items.name: KanvasLockComponents
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to lock a component's state present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasAddComponents
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to copy a component present on canvas. The canvas is where the design and all it's components are displayed and configured. This permission grants the user the ability to cofigure/edit/update a design by adding new components to the canvas.

items.name: KanvasConfigureComponentStyles
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to configure the style of a component.

items.name: KanvasResetComponentStyles
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to reset a component to it's initial style.

items.name: KanvasResizeComponents
items.feature: In Kanvas, a Component is a fundamental building block used to represent and define the infrastructure under management. Each component provides granular and specific support for your infrastructure and applications. This permission grants the user the ability to reset a component to it's initial style.

items.name: KanvasDeleteShapes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to delete a shape from canvas.

items.name: KanvasCloneShapes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a shape  on canvas.

items.name: KanvasCopyShapes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a shape on canvas.

items.name: KanvasLockShapes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to lock a shape on canvas.

items.name: KanvasAddShapes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to add new shapes on canvas.

items.name: KanvasConfigureShapeStyles
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to configure the styles of shapes present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasResetShapeStyles
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to reset the styles of shapes present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasDeleteTextboxes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to delete a textbox from canvas.

items.name: KanvasCloneTextboxes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a textbox on canvas.

items.name: KanvasCopyTextboxes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a textbox on canvas.

items.name: KanvasLockTextboxes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to lock a textbox on canvas.

items.name: KanvasAddTextboxes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to add new textboxes on canvas.

items.name: KanvasConfigureTextboxStyles
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to configure the styles of textboxes present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasResetTextboxStyles
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to reset the styles of textboxes present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasDeleteSections
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to delete a section from canvas.

items.name: KanvasCloneSections
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a section on canvas.

items.name: KanvasCopySections
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a section on canvas.

items.name: KanvasLockSections
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to lock a section on canvas.

items.name: KanvasAddSections
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to add new sections on canvas.

items.name: KanvasConfigureSectionStyles
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to configure the styles of sections present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasResetSectionStyles
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to reset the styles of sections present on canvas.

items.name: KanvasAddTextToTextboxes
items.feature: Kanvas Designer allows users to draw shapes, lines, text, add custom styles, images and icons to represent the components and relationships of Kubernetes clusters as they see fit. This permission grants the user the ability to add text to the textboxes currently on canvas.

items.name: KanvasChangeDesignLayout
items.feature: Like a Google Doc, Designs are a user's primary tool for collaborative authorship of their infrastructure and services. A Design describes all the resources and their properties that users wants for a single deployment based on Meshery’s declarative syntax. This permission grants the user the ability to change the layout of the components in the design.

items.name: KanvasUndoOrRedo
items.feature: This permission grants the user the ability to undo/redo any action in done in Kanvas

items.name: KanvasUsePencil
items.feature: Pencil is mouse/tool mode available in Kanvas that allows users to draw freehand shapes. This permission grants user the ability to use the pencil mode in Kanvas.

items.name: KanvasUsePen
items.feature: Pen is a mouse/tool mode available in Kanvas that allows users to draw edges from one component to another. This permission grants user the ability to use the pencil mode in Kanvas.

items.name: KanvasWhiteboarding
items.feature: Ability to freeform draw any shapes, draw edges

items.name: KanvasVisualDesign
items.feature: Drag-n-drop cloud native infrastructure designer to configure, model, and deploy your workloads

items.name: KanvasModels
items.feature: Generator for GCP via K8s CRDs

items.name: KanvasViewHelpCenter
items.feature: Help center houses various ways through which the users might try to learn more about the Kanvas and it's features or reach out through various channels for help. This permission grants the user the ability to view the help center and use it's features

items.name: KanvasScreenshotCanvas
items.feature: The canvas is where the design and all it's components are displayed. This permission grants the user the ability to take a screenshot of the current state of canvas

items.name: KanvasConfigureVisibleLayers
items.feature: Layers refer to the collection of various entities present on the canvas, for example, components, relationships, component badges, etc. This permission grants the user the ability to decide which entities to display/hide on the canvas.

items.name: KanvasCreateBlankDesignInKanvas
items.feature: The canvas is where the design and all it's components are displayed and configured. This permission grants the user the ability to remove all current entities from the canvas and create a new one to start from scratch

items.name: KanvasSaveDesignInKanvas
items.feature: Like a Google Doc, Designs are your primary tool for collaborative authorship of your infrastructure and services. A Design describes all the resources and their properties that you want for a single deployment based on Meshery’s declarative syntax. This permission grants the user the ability to save a design (while logged in)

items.name: KanvasViewComments
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to view comments in a design on canvas.

items.name: KanvasResolveAComment
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to resolve a comment thread in a design on canvas.

items.name: KanvasDeleteComments
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to delete a comment on canvas.

items.name: KanvasCloneComments
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to clone a comment on canvas.

items.name: KanvasCopyComments
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to copy a comment on canvas.

items.name: KanvasLockComments
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to lock a comment on canvas.

items.name: KanvasAddComments
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to add a comment on canvas.

items.name: KanvasConfigureCommentStyles
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions. This permission grants the user the ability to configure the styles of a comment on canvas.

items.name: KanvasResetCommentStyles
items.feature: Kanvas’s Designer enables users to place comments “inline” within designs. Comments can be used to offer feedback to team members, take detailed design notes, capture helpful tips for team members, and include justification as to infrastructure and application configuration decisions.
